Excellent petit RPG !!
Malgré les voix française raté, et certains bug en multijoueur, le gameplay reste excellent.

Dieses Spiel machte sehr viel spaß auf der Konsole (XBOX360) und machte richtig krassen Spaß auf Steam.
Vieles an dem Spiel ist fragwürdig und schlecht.




Daher zähl ich mal das positive auf:

- Entdecken ist sehr sehr geil und aufregend
- Dufte Synchronsprecher
- Man wird von dem Spiel motiviert alles zu töten was sich im bewegungsfähigen Zustand befindet
- Einmalige Erlebnisse durch gezieltes Kopfschütteln ohne Anwesenheit andere Menschen
- 1,29€ im Sale (Jedes Quartal mal wieder)
- Das Sammeln von Zeugs ist optimal für Messis wie mich

Wichtige Negativpunkte:

- Es ist anfangs sehr ungewohnt
- Die Gegner passen sich nicht der Level an, sondern haben eine vorgegebene Level (Je nach Region)
----- Was soviel bedeutet wie: Die Gegner sind entweder zu schwach oder zu stark
- Man wird von dem Spiel motiviert alles zu töten was sich im bewegungsfähigen Zustand befindet
I really like an old school dungeon crawler.  Unfortunately, the camera controls, odd crafting, and horrid horse control make this game almost unbearable.

Cannot get the game to launch, downloading the Legacy Driver did NOT fix the issue.

If you want to buy it while the sale is on, like I did, buyer beware, you might be buying something you will NEVER be able to play.

What makes this worse, is the game has been out for almost 3 years now, and STILL has not been patched.
Why aren't you playing Skyrim?
absolute classic tbh

I have never in my life played a game with such horrible voice acting!

Read the following in a monotonous a voice as possible.

The. Game. Has. Terrible. Voice. Acting.
The. Graphics. Are. Low. But. Do. Not. Ruin. Game-Play. In Any. Way.

Alright I cant handle the voice any more. If you think you'll be able to play a game wher every single charcter talks to you like you're a dim witted man who mysteriously landed yourself in a land where everyone sometimes think that they have to talk to you like they're in a Shakespearean play while being voiced by microsoft sam, then read on. If not then you may aswell save yourself some time and leave the page now.

The games have some meh-points aswell. they're not bad, they're just not so good that they make up for the faults. They're meh.
The inventory is somewhat simple, but quite clumsy.
Upgrading weapons is done by putting them on top of weapons of the same kind (this is not explained in the game).

The combat system is to my fairly limited eperience in this game actually quite nice and function well. The same goes for the character skill page, which is nice and simple, but offers a decent variety in skills.

It's just the voice acting. It might actually prevent me from playing any further in this game, because it's so bad. 
I cannot recommend this game.

Решил таки написать обзор об этой игре, порадовал большой красивый мир , большой выбор оружия , различной магии , приятная графика. И немножко о плохом: В самом в начале игры , персонаж имеет то-ли 3 отмычки , либо 5  отмычек (точное количесвто не помню) и их совершенно не хвтает что-бы открыть обычный сундук , приходиться сохраняться и пробывать снова, так же если и прокачать навык взлома замков до максимума  все равно на обычном замке можно потратить от 4  до 8 отмычек , по факту такой замок должен открываться с первой же попытки, и  встречаются даже пустые сундуки с превосходным замком , тратишь на него отмычки , а внутри пусто , и зачем спрашивается ставить туда превосходный замок , если там ничего не хранится , обычного было бы вполне достаточно , и этот непонятный навык плавания , зачем он вообще нужен т.к в игре особо плавать не приходилось , всего-то 1 раз поплыл на островок чтобы активировать портал , еще улыбнул призрак скелета , впервый раз видел подобное, в целом если не придераться к мелочам , игра все-таки хорошая , стоит поиграть 7\10

Pros:
-Loved the massive armor and weapon selections, gives a collector like me some fun!
-Unique landscapes, enemies, and mounts
-Large map for explorers like me!

Cons:
-Dialogue leaves something to be desired
-Combat system leaves something to be desired
-Enemies are either no challenge or impossible

Overall:
I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed TES: Oblivion.

Gra jest nudna niczym flaki z olejem. Mechanika walki jest niesamowicie sztampowa, koszmarnie wykreowane questy wymagając od gracza przebycia sporej odległości i nie wnoszą nic do fabuły, inteligencja (a właściwie jej brak) NPC'tów oraz głównego bohatera powalała mnie za każdym razem. Poważnie. Ta gra nie ma niczego czym mógłbym ją pochwalić. W połowie znudziłem się i postanowiłem wykonywać misje główne...... Grałem w tą grę, ukończyłem ją i żałuję.....

O mundo aberto é bem vasto e o sistema de alquimia tem infinitas possibilidades, principalmente pq vc pode fazer combinações próprias e cada uma com um resultado diferente!
Além disso, as quests e side-quests são bem feitas e vão contando a trama do jogo aos poucos...
Recomendo!
Güzel Değil

I SKIPPED EVERY SINGLE DIALOG SCENE IN THIS GAME THE VOICE ACTING IS ATROCIOUSLY HORRIBLE AND I COULD NOT STAND IT! However, thats the worst thing about the game.  Otherwise it feels like an unpolished and just lackluster Elder Scrolls game.  Just spend the extra $10 to buy Morrowind instead.
I'm sure this game is terrible, but I can't even get past the DRM. I haven't seen a fix for it, but it is insane. What game asks for your phone number to actually play the game? Ridiculous.

THIS IS NOT EASY TO GET WORKING. Now you clearly know that if you are willing to get it to work it is a very fun game that have a fun combat sytem that lets you kill tons of stuff and upgrade your very cool equipment up to very high levels. There is tons of magic and wepons and armor. Now the story has the worst voice acting in history, but the story is not that bad if you can deal with it, and can be funny. This is worth your money if you have the time to get it working in the first place, and yes it has online resiter that is extemly unrelible, but the online sever I believe are still on if you want to play with friends.

I was running a quad core 2.8ghz AMD Phenom 2 processor, with 6 gb's of RAM and a 2 gb 550 Ti GPU when I tried running this.  It still ran like shit.

Don't even consider thinking whether or not you should get this game, it's fucking garbage.

[h1]REPLAY VALUE[/h1]

I wish there was a "meh" rating.  I actually wanted to start playing Two Worlds 2 but this game came cheap in a package so I decided to give it a good try.

I guess my main problem is I was expecting it to be similar to Gothic 3 but it isn't.  The combat in Two Worlds is a tad too hack n slash for my taste.  Combat became sort of repetitive after a while.  Also, the sound effects are a bit corny as if the reverb is turned up.  Keeping up with the myriad of inventory choices and item upgrades became a chore.  The friggin horse is hard to steer also. I'm starting to nitpick now.

Anyway,  I could have continued playing but there is so much out there that's better.

I Put many hours into this game on it's release.

Requires a fix to run with modern nvidia cards but other than that i have encountered no errors.

This game is huge and there is a lot of stuff to do for a game that constantly 99 cents on steam. You should just have it in your library

If you big into RPG's i recommend atleast sinking a few hours into this.

I enjoy going back and playing older RPGs now and again and this is one i like going back to.

Was nice to actually get it to play with everything at max i remember my old rig i had when this came out was not up to par running it.

Where to start? 

The controls for PC are poorly optimized (having played this on both 360 and PC). The combat system is more screwy than anyone should have to wrap their head around. The plot is atrocious, and the content of the game is repetative and generally junk. 

All this could even possibly be forgiven..... If... just if the creatures in the game ACTUALLY RESPAWNED. Yes. You heard it right. Nothing in this game respawns. Once an area is cleared of monsters, they are gone forever. Not that it really matters, because this is one of the ONLY open-world games where when you complete the main quest, the game simply ends. And not even in a satisfying manner. 

Seriously, avoid at all costs. The ONLY good thing to come from this game is the ridiculously good menu theme music. Which is the only reason I give this game a 2/10.

De manière générale, c'est un bon petit jeu type monde ouvert, auquel on peut jouer en attendant la sortie de jeux ayant un peu plus d'intérêt. Ce qui m'a le plus gêné, c'est le côté très "action" du jeu : on a rarement le choix, les combats sont un peu basiques, le joueur devient rapidement un big boss qui a plein d'argent et de points de compétences sans que le jeu n'offre de réelles possibilités de le dépenser. Bref : c'est pas extra, mais c'est pas mal pour tromper l'ennui quand c'est la pénurie :D

Les plus :
-les graphismes dans l'ensemble sont assez basiques mais ça reste très correct.
-les voix françaises : le voice acting est tellement pourri que c'en est vraiment marrant. Genre le bandit qui dit "ouille" quand on lui tape dessus :D
-les sorts sont plutôt variés, mais ils ont tendance à se ressembler entre écoles de magie.
-monde vraiment ouvert
-système de téléportations
-système de pierres qui redonnent de la vie/du mana quand on est à proximité
-système de réputation dans les différentes factions. Sauf que finalement, il est facile d'être aimé par deux factions rivales, ce qui est... étranger, du point de vue RP.

Les moins :
-au niveau du décor : de nombreuses erreurs d'ajustement des tiles, qui font que la disposition des éléments est pas très naturelle. C'est pas très immersif du coup...
-erreurs au niveau de certains dialogues.
-certains sorts sont vraiment inutiles : le sort de résurrection ne marche pas chez moi (bug ?), le "dragon blanc" est en fait un genre de scorpion tout moche qui fait des dégâts ridicules.
-pas beaucoup de soin apporté à l'apparence des créatures invoquées.
-possibilités très limitées au niveau de la création du personnage principal.
-bugs graphiques : on peut se téléporter, mais certains effets visuels ne suivent pas et restent actifs à l'endroit d'où l'on vient (par ex. le sort de régénération).
-on peut ou pas faire les quêtes, mais on a très rarement le choix dans la manière de les conduire.
-j'ai fait un mage : une fois qu'on est un super boss dans toutes les écoles de magie, on ne sait pas trop quoi faire de ses points de compétence... Et ce moment arrive assez vite dans le jeu.
-les musiques sont vraiment pas terribles. C'est pas atroce, mais bon, quand même...
-les combats sont pas très intéressants. Quand on est un mage, ça se résume pas mal à cliquer sur le sol "boule de feu" (ou un autre, en fonction de l'école de magie et du niveau) en continu.
-il y a un système de points colorés pour les quêtes sur la carte mais...  il n'y a pas de légende pour expliquer à quoi correspondent les couleurs. En plus ça n'est pas toujours clair si le point correspond au donneur de quête ou à la cible.
-le système de commerce est inexistant : les commerçants ont toujours de l'argent (à l'infini) et le joueur devient vite riche à millions sans avoir de possibilité très intéressante de dépenser son or.

I highly do NOT RECOMMEND this piece of crap. This is probably the worse rpg game i ever played, and i didn't play it for long. The graphics sucks, the combat sucks, the weapons suck, every damn thing in this game sucks. DO NOT BUY IT unless you want to waste your money.

Подведём итог:
1) Интерес
2) Атмосфера

首先， 对国人而言，最难过的就是全英文，而且没有任何汉化资源，虽然文字比较小白，但是本作的字体看起来不舒服，所以仍然不适合英语水平一般的人入手。
第二，这是一款老游戏，我们不能用巫师3的要求来对这款游戏进行要求。我没有仔细查看过游戏的发售消息，但是没记错的话应该是在老滚4左右发售的。而且这款游戏里面可以看到不少老滚的影子，于是我们用老滚来作为对比的对象。说实话游戏开发来说，一个小制作组想做一款老滚类似的游戏是很有压力的，但是本作有几点做的很不好。
1.地图大，但是很空，老滚的地图大小一直是玩家比较喜欢的特点，本作我虽然没有查过地图大小，但是个人感觉至少有老滚5的3成以上的大小，但是很空，沿着道路跑半天，洞穴什么的完全没有，也没有村落或者聚居点之类的东西，看到的最多的就是强盗半兽人。
2.敌人种类说实话不少，但是都比较集中，基本上整个地图只能和野猪和狼做敌人说实话真的很对不起玩家的不断跑图破雾。
3.游戏人物动作方面，说实话作为一款RPG游戏来说打击感什么的其实没有那么重要，但是跑几步卡一次，包括人物转向这一些动作都是十分笨拙的，十分闹心。战斗的话，走法师或者弓箭手的话其实还不错，但是近战的那一套动作连招实在闹心，不打完输出少，想打完的话，击中敌人后没有硬直，基本上就是换血。但是装备不能加强，只能不断刷商店或者看掉落。换血实在打起来不舒服。
4.战斗的话我再说一下法师，首先，本作没有汉化，有些技能实在只能脑补，而且很多技能不是指向性的，而且固定距离释放，这个比较考验玩家的熟练度。其实影响最大的还是本作的魔法精通体系，它和l老滚有很大的不同，老滚是熟练度加上天赋树的线性加强，只要技能用的多，总会有输出，但是本作的话，你想提升自己的魔法输出，你需要不断的去收集卡片，不断地刷商店，但是技能卡片其实价格不低，不断的清怪，收集掉落，卖了然后再买的话实在是太浪费时间了，于是我很不要脸的推荐控制台调金币，要不然法师玩起来实在是心累加蛋疼的事情。但是，无论是哪个商店，卡片的掉落都是随机的，我玩了10个小时，其中至少有3个小时是在不断打的刷卡片，但是我仍然一张5级法术都没有，但是控制台代码又没有翻译。一个个试实在是很浪费时间的举动，所以我主线流程都没有打完就删掉了游戏。
5、再说一下弓箭手，我实在是觉得弓箭是最简单的职业，主升敏捷，减伤高，而且作为一个弓箭手的话，你完全没必要去升级战士的减伤技能。掌握几个低级召唤术，然后不断用弓箭射就是了，主升4个弓箭的被动就行了。而弓箭的主动实在是没有什么作用，而装备实在要求太低，只要箭袋和弓箭就行，防御装实在是可有可无的东西。

综合评价，游戏创意方面不错，但是实在不是一款好游戏，所以我这里还是不推荐玩家在steam入正。
good game wish it would be updated to support windows 10

Love this game - despite a few awkward flaws, like a map that isn't very clear, wolves around every corner, storylines that aren't linear - so you start asking after things your character hasn't not heard of before - like what about the excavations....eh? Which excavations...where...? Still, beautiful landscapes, a LOT of quests - and  a real bargain at the steam sales.

Well, after playing quite a lot and still playing I decided to recommend this game, at least to rpg funs. I am saying this because with a ton of games available today and so many on sale offers, one may easily abandon a game and go for another.
Why I like this game? It is addictive. It keeps you playing for its advantages regardless its flaws. I have a lot of games, games I go back playing like skyrim, games I do not stop until I complete them like shadow of Mordor and games I never start playing yet. Too many games, too few time. Still, two worlds is a game that I start and did not abandon nor I will anytime soon. This game has something strangely addictive. For example I abandon dark souls about mid game while been an excellent game but I am now mid-game at two worlds and I hardy spent this little time to write this, right now I prefer to enter the game and continue.
To describe this game very briefly, it is like diablo on levelling and items, like oblivion on world environment feeling and like divinity 2 on movement and combat. It also has some unique gameplay elements on its own.
What you need to know primarily is that tutorial is brief and very basic. This game needs your close attention to understand it. The first time I play I think there were major flaws and bad designs but with a second and third closer careful looks I understand that I was wrong. Once you understand how things work it is where you really get addicted. I am sure that most negative reviews comes from hasty gamers. I do not blame them, a modern game needs to have a proper tutorial, a complex game a large tutorial, this game most likely relies on the manual.
Let’s get on details(the bad stuff at the end):
The character: You only play a male human character, no females and no races. That’s it. Also your starting character is fixed, fixed attributes and fixed starting skills. You cannot start with point pool and boost what you like. However the starting skills are the basic ones and at level 1 of 10. You can level up and increase any you like. All starting skills are all you need to do all essential things and secondary actions. For example you have lock pick 1 and you can lock pick and also increase it for a better chance. You do not have alchemy skill but you can still use alchemy. Finally, playing the game and visit villages and towns will allow you to meet trainers that will teach you the level 1 of all skills eventually, so there is no skill point cost at all for level 1 skill. If for example you want to advance alchemy or water magic you do not start with, all you need is to find the appropriate trainers to get the 1st skill point by paying some money. While levelling you get 5 attribute points and one or two skill points, usually one. You may also get one skill point before you level up but I have not yet figure out when, the game has many good secrets. You can also permanently increase attributes using alchemy even without skill 1, if you find the proper ingredients. In other words the game is rewarding for the good and smart player offering more than the standard gain experience and fixed level up procedure. Two level 10 characters for example may be different, one may be even 40% stronger from extra attributes and skills alone.
The gear and items: Items are much like diablo, leveled items and many auxiliary items, consumables and especially ingredients. The only disadvantage here if it is one is that there are too many items. Not just leveled, too many items. Perhaps the greatest variety on gear I have ever seen. Ready consumables are just what is needed. Ingredients are plenty and not only herbs but also parts from animals and various minerals. There are also gems as consumables to add different types of damage to weapons, traps to set, spell cards and spell boosters and few standard items like the teleport stone and quest items.
One unique gameplay element here is that you can enhance any gear item, weapon or armor with another piece of item of the same type. Items have a special attribute called ‘class’ which is usually one. If you have a short sword for example and find another one you can drag and drop it one another and you will now have a class 2 short sword which of course is a little better, doing more damage in that case. This is a very good thing and very useful, as it allows you to use trivial equipment to avoid buying everything from the store at every couple of levels or so, or live and die by drop chance alone. For example I used a Grom Shield that happened to be a very common item groms carry and drop so I end up finding about 30 or so, effectively had a class 30 simple grom shield with a parry number high enough to keep me up to level 10 or so. Then there were better shields to buy and enemies no longer often carry that shield, so it was time to change. Spell cards also stack. Add a second and third and so on card of the same spell and the spell becomes stronger, requiring more mana however. Finally gems can be placed on a weapon for extra damage and you can put as many as you like as long as they are of the same type, e.g. rubies that add fire damage.
Money and trading: Surprisingly money are always needed here, and the game offers a fair amount of money. The trading is active to this game. You always earn cash and you always have reasons to spent, and not on consumables exclusively. I’d rather say you may spent for making your hero more powerful. Enemies either drop inventory with a fair amount of gold and random items or a single standard automatic pickup, like the wolf drops a wolf heart which is an ingredient.  Anything may drop but specific items have better sources to be harvested and animals and beast always drop standard ingredient item instead of inventory. All except single pickups are level depended, chests, enemy inventories and shops. You are bored looking for ingredients that increase your stats permanently? No problem, pay some attention to mage shops and after a certain level you definitely come across to buy.
Enemies: Good variety of enemies, large size enemies are really deadly and not level depended, leveled enemies are logical like bandits; they got stronger but not as much as you.
Classes: The 3 archetypes work well, fighter, mage and archer/thief that is. Hybrids also work well. There is depth on each single archetype, fighting style and weapons for fighters, magic schools for mages and lots of choices to master for an archer/thief.
The story is interesting, the world is very good at least. The soundtrack is almost perfect.

Now the bad stuff: 
The back-jump. Honestly I hated that. In my opinion it ruins melee. I do not even assigned it to a button. The game is much better without. Again, my opinion.
The dialogues. Not sure what English dialect that is but it is strange until you get used to it. Also some times are almost childish, some other times are very mature. Your hero speaks quite well though.
The NPC characters. Quite average.
The spells. They are lots and great and come in form of cards that stack and extra spell booster cards (more damage, less mana etch). However you may have 3 spells with booster cards (that also stack), the others need some special way to be placed on your custom hot bar, first on the spell amulet and then on the hot bar. No big deal but somewhat annoying.
this game doesn't work and has zero support. Total waste of money

This game is... Bad.

So bad that the single player is entirely not worth it and beyond saving- there's no point to playing it, and as many has said before the voice acting is awful and characters not at all memorable.

But that has somehow not made this game a terrible purchase for me. You see, I bought three copies of it while on sale for shits and giggles once I saw the multiplayer tag, expecting a few hours of cheap laughter and something to bash on.

I got exactly that and more. The combat is -just barely- engaging enough to drag you in, but broken enough to be completely conquered by several players together, at low levels. I've related all the dragging and running from monsters and the fact that melee combat is awful at lower levels to being rather realistic. It's like some strange dark comedy where you run from hordes of wolves, bears, undead, grom, and ghost bears to take to the towns people who of course mob upon it and destroy it in seconds. But while doing this, you'll of course start to grow and gain more and more experience, levelling up in a sort of Dark Souls manner. In fact, the combat of the game sort of reminds me of the souls games, like a simplified version without repostes or other mechanics- but a dodge and parry button can be used, and it can be used well enough that there's a skill cap to melee combat. And you can mold your character however you want past the beginning much like in Dark Souls as well- you want to be an ice mage wearing huge armor? Sure. Sneaky necromancer who stabs people with a spear? Absolutely. It might not hold your hand and it certainly won't be fair at times but that can be forgiven with the strangely mesmeric depth of character possibilities and gameplay on several open world maps, even if you can't change their appearance to begin with past a few sliders that make no sense. For the sake of difficulty, I'd recommend starting as a magic class and then change into whatever you like later on- equipment has no restrictions except for stats and many spells just need a few points into their respective fields of magic. And somehow the game keeps things refreshing even if you lose all progress on a map when you exit the multiplayer session (you can, of course, unlock many maps through progression of the multiplayer and pick up on those irregardless) by having the enemy spawns and loot be interchangeable. One time a encampment of orcs happened to have a sand dragon instead of its usual, far over levelled and idiotic to fight. But we killed it and took its mediocre loot with a sense of accomplishment. Dying means nothing in this game as spawn points are everywhere and they heal you- but it still has managed to be fun? 

The setting is easily laughable and the characters forgettable but this is a game I can find myself recommending to play with multiplayer and a few friends. It's just enough of a clone to many well known games that you can find yourself having fun while breaking and bending it to your whim. As an example, animals are afraid of many fields of fire magic and you can also easily stun lock enemies with the water magic's AOE capabilities forever, even if when they take damage they unfreeze. Me and my friend has somehow made this challenging in unexpected ways and still had fun seeking adversity. Don't take yourself seriously while playing this game- imagine it like some poorly made table top game that your little sibling/relative made to impress you but somehow manages to entertain you at the same time despite its broken aspects. 

All in all, the singleplayer is worthless but the multiplayer is a surprising gem with qualities of Dark Souls, Diablo stye looting, and Oblivion small open world maps with quests to deal with. I can't recommend the full price but you absolutely should pick it up on sale for five bucks a copy- it's like a cheesy movie you'll find yourself enamored with.

Also, it charmingly included alchemy into a multiplayer game and that seems rather cool to me. 

TLDR: Buy it on sale for five bucks or less to play with your friends who all have hamachi. You'll get some time of entertainment.

Why did I even play this game? 

1) I hated the wonky controls-Usually in these kinds of games using the keyboard and mouse as a control scheme, the spacebar is jump, but not this one, it is the actioin button. 

2) No direction-Seriously, no direction at all. The game starts in this temple place and you have no clue what is going on. Well, granted, I did skip the beginning cutscene, but still, it doesnt really explain much.

3) Almost no character creation-Like, what's the point of this games character development? You can only change the hair style and color and facisl features of your character, but thats it, might as well be a predesigned character anyways.

Lastly, I could only stomach 30 minutes of this game. There is no map button, there is no easy way to block, the bar at the bottom of the screen doewssnt really work all that well.

Bonus-NO TUTORIAL!!!!!!! 

Do NOT buy or play this game!!

Nothing epic about it. I know it may be a start for the company, but it's an ugly game, deformed models, (those male hairs, by the gods, I want a cool character, not uncle smith), awkward controls and bad, very bad lip sycnhing.

And why do they even want to know my zipcode? And why do they want something to do with my proxy? Felt like reading spam mail asking for my personal data.

People want to play games, not be obligated to answer your dumb research. Ask politely elsewhere, don't force us to answer it before we can even play. -_-'

Here's what you need to enjoy this game:
You like MST3K and think you'll enjoy [b]terrible voice acting[/b] and [b]awful plot[/b] in the so-bad-it's-good way.
You're a munchkin in the RPG-sense and like to break games and build ridiculously overpowered characters and find new and interesting bugs.

Не ждите от этой игры [b]Cкайрима[/b] или [b]Готики[/b]. Здесь скучные диалоги, персонажи-близнецы, незамысловатый сюжет (состоящий, примерно, из 10-15 миссий), однотипные задания, почти полное отсутствие свободы выбора (встречается лишь пару раз), неоптимизированный движок (единственным плюсом которого является довольно быстрая скорость загрузки), огромная (ОГРОМНАЯ) карта, на которой практически нечего делать. Уникальных предметов вы здесь не найдете - только монстры да сундуки, в которых лежат те же самые вещи, что и везде. Кстати, насчет уникальных предметов - их вообще нет - все оружие и доспехи продают обычные торговцы. Территория для иследования огромна и довольна разнообразна, но опять же, делать на ней практически нечего, кроме как истреблять монстров, орков или бандитов. Боевая система - закликай врага. Встечаются баги (например, не открывающиеся ворота) из-за которых пройти квест можно только с помощью читов. Система прокачки - стандартная. Управление - немного странное (сохранение Alt+F1), но привыкнуть можно. Из интересных особенностей - возможность объединять одинаковые вещи, делая их мощнее. К плюсам можно отнести саундтрек. 2 концовки, на которые влияет только решение в самом конце - до зевоты скучны. Почему же я рекомендую её?  Всё дело в простоте - если вы не ищете сложную запутанную RPG - купите, но только со скидкой. Имея в арсенале кучу минусов, [b]Two Worlds[/b] тем не менее, увлекает, может и ненадолго, но для единственного прохождения её хватит.
P.S. Совместимость с windows 10 в порядке, однако не забудьте установить [b]PhysX[/b] - без него не запустится.
P.S.S. Наиграл более 70 часов лишь из-за того, что хотел изучить всю территорию. Хотел - потому что это слишком скучно.

I first came across this game in a website article about the worst RPG games of all time.  Being a conniseur of the truly awful and noble defender of that which is unjustly labeled so, I must say that this is indeed a good game.  It is not an Elder Scrolls game, nor does it try to be.  It is however a fun game.  the unique item upgrade system whereby stacking an item on top of an identical item makes a stronger item.  This made looting more fun and strategic, do you lose the weaker sword in favor of the better sword? or do you keep the weaker sword because you know it's more common and could be upgraded to be more powerful than the better sword?  Weapons have slashing, bashing, or pearsing damage.  And enemies have different resistances to each, and not mild resistances either, it's a case of 'look it's a skeleton, should I use (A) a sword and half a dozen health potions and kill it in about 15-30 hits, or, (B) a club no potions and kill it in 2-3 hits.
If anything, the game reminds me of an open world titan quest with 3rd person view and WASD movement.
Tons of side quests and one of the only games where being the brave hero type can screw over innocent people.

This game is often on special and it only cost me $1 something.

Buy it, relax and have fun.

Two Worlds is one of those games that is so bad that it ends up being a little good. Although it is impossible to take seriously, the game can actually be quite absorbing once you get into the swing of it. 


The game has aged quite poorly, and even getting it to run properly can be a nightmare. One you get it to run properly, you may be faced with constant crashes, although I have not had these issues. That being said, the game actually runs somewhat well on the PC, which is a nice contrast to the 360 port, where the game runs under 30 FPS at almost all times. On both PC and 360, the game often lags hard when you kill someone or when you level up as you kill someone. This sometimes makes a very damaging blow quite satisifying, but most of the time it's just annoying.


Moving on from the technical side of this game, we need to take a quick stop to look at the story and voice acting. The story is quite generic. Some evil dudes kidnap your sister and you need to get her back. The voice acting, on the other hand, is anything but generic. This game has the worst voice acting I have ever heard in a major title. Even the protagonist's voice acting is terrible, with laughably bad writing to boot. The voice acting and story go hand-in-hand to make a hilariously bad story experience that you can't help but laugh at when playing the game.


Before we take a look at gameplay, I want to touch on graphics. The graphics, specifically the face rendering, are simply bad for the time that this game was produced. By contrast, many of the environments look quite nice. It feels like the artists really put some effort into this part of the game. Graphics almost never make or break a game, but I wanted to touch on it.


Now for the gameplay and replayability. The gameplay in the game is quite repetitive, but something about it is addictive. You often adopt the same strategies to kill many enemies, but actually figuring out what those strategies are can be quite fun. For example, I found that a mixture of critical strike, defensive combat, and traps allowed me to easily tackle any enemy. However, experimenting with other paths can be quite fun as well, which is where the game's replayability comes in. Although I found that the critical strike build was simply the best build, I did have fun experimenting with an amplification nuke mage for a bit. Sadly, the mana costs were too prohibitive, but experimentation like this is what helps keep the game fresh.

Although some have complained about the game's difficulty curve rising too quickly, it is likely that those same people missed many of the essential side quests that allow you to level your character and tackle larger enemies.  For example, if you skip the first major city (Tharbakin), you will fall behind drastically in levels. Just like in other RPGs, if you tackle the main quest first, you will pay dearly. The general rule for gameplay difficulty in this game is as follows: the further south you go, the harder the game gets, and when you cross the river, the game gets significantly harder.

The gameplay is where the game redeems itself and comes into its own. Somehow, this gimmicky gameplay where you find the best way to abuse the game's skill and combat system is quite addicting, and you often find yourself playing for hours at a time to see just how badly you can abuse the game. Through my strategy of mixing critical chance, critical strike, and defensive combat, I was able to build a character that would crit on virtually every attack for 250% damage, quickly disposing of my foes. For any bigger characters, I would abuse the game's traps and bad enemy pathing and walk the enemies into the traps before I unleashed on them with critical strikes. Attempting to abuse the game in different ways allows for many hours of replayabilty.

Before wrapping up the review, I want to quickly address the Xbox 360 port of this game. When I first played this game, I played it on an Xbox 360, and that experience shaped my opinion of the game quite negatively. The game lags quite extensively, and the combat system is significantly worse because the controls are just horendous. Lastly, for some inexplicable reason, critical strikes are broken on console. You cannot crit people. This means that killing even modest enemies requires you to have many traps and bombs and patiently kill them. This drawback is very large and detracts heavily from the gameplay experience on console. I would recommend at least looking at the PC port if you played the 360 version and did not enjoy it.


This game, despite its big flaws, actually ends up being a mediocre but very addictive fantasy RPG. I would never even pretend that it could compete with games like Oblivion, but something about it is quite addictive and can leave you playing it for hours on end as you try to find the best way to cheese the game and abuse the combat systems. I would never dream of paying $60 for this game, but I would recommend it at $5 or below. It is worth it just for the hilariously bad story and voice acting at $5, and if you enjoy it, you will actually get quite a bit of value out of it as you can easily end up sinking 50+ hours into this game.

玩游戏花掉25小时，然后剩下20小时读完了官方的Strategy Guide.顺便我还买了此游戏的典藏版和普通盒装版。
可见我对这个游戏是非常喜爱的。一方面因为我是RPG死忠，但更重要的是这真的真的是一个好！游！戏！
可以说它具有一个开放式沙盒RPG该有的一切：属性点、技能点，多种职业方向（战士法师弓箭手），各式各样的装备（矛戟刀剑、弓杖匕首、斧头棍锤），多种多样的技能（骑马游泳、潜行偷盗、以及各种战斗技能），光魔法就分5系，每一系又有10多种技能，
炼金系统，声望系统等等…………
任务也相当多，并不显得无聊，常常还需要玩家自己做出抉择改变NPC们的命运。
至于很多人在乎的打击感，这个游戏是欠缺的，但对我来说丝毫不影响（我一直奇怪RPG要酣畅的打击感干嘛= =）。
最后很重要的是，这是一个老游戏，受不了画质的请直接忽略。

I thought I'd give this game a try even though plenty seem to find it terrible and unfortunately I have to agree.
This game is very outdated with ugly graphics and atrocious voice acting. Nothing managed to grab me and want to keep playing, story seems boring and cliche.

I normally try to play a game for at least 10 hours before writing a review, but the voice acting immediately put me off, sounds very robotic with no emotion behind the words, sounds like someone is bored and just reading the lines half heartedly straight off the bat.
The default controls are horrible as well, space for action and e for jump.

At least you can change it. Though I could not map shift to anything at all and trying to map the tilde key just resulted in opening a dialogue function.

Character creation is extremely limited, you can only play as a male and change his hair and features a tiny bit.

I do not need to play much at all to decide that I really hate playing this game. It's terrible in every way. Talking to NPC's is like a form of torture, listening to dialogue that sounds like someone is very bored makes me want to mute the sound. 

A waste of time to play such a bad game when there are heaps better games I can spend my time playing. I only have playtime more than an hour as I was trying to get all the card drops.

But if you feel the need to give it a try maybe get it on a sale. But to me this game is not worth playing even if it was free. 
I'd rate it 4/10 as it is not a joy for me  to play at all.

Positives ist vielleicht die Story, und mit ca. 25 Std. Spielspaß bietet Oblivion dann doch viel mehr (wo ich über 300 Std. gespielt habe, und nein, nicht auf Steam).

right so i have played through the whole game from start to finish, got to the bit of saving kira i thought to myself "oh this will be fun to finally kill that guy who betrayed me i do wonder how it will end" then i get a choice of either saving kira or just fucking shit over but i was the nice guy who saved kira oh but hold on where the fuck is she ? not there ? why in the world am i even here then? and then it sent me back to the main menu at first i thought it was just a glitch and so i did it all again, killed the twat, "rescued" kira but  then it sent me back to the main menu like wtf is that it ? no story finisher? no cutscene? not even any credits to say thanks for playing and so on ?(SORRY FOR SPOILER) what kind of a fucking ending is that ? if ya gonna make an rpg game and have alot of story in it then have no fucking ending ya may aswell of not bothered....however apart from the ending the rest of the game is good but still wouldnt recommend this to others

Two Worlds is a tough game. The voice acting, horse-riding and combat at times, is all very shit. Sometimes they have their moments but most of the time they struggke to reach average. But if you can somehow get past the inital crap then you find a gem.

Two Worlds is surprisingly deep, with a intriguing, large  and beautiful world.
The armor and weapons that you find start off looking rather dumb but soon you start finding very epic looking swords and axes, awesome spiked plate armor, damn i really liked one set of armor that i kept it for far longer then i should of, making the game harder then it should of been.
The crafting system in Two Worlds is very simple, just drag and drop, but i felt it went very well with the style of game and allowd even weaker waepons to stay strong with a little extra effort.
Alchemy is done well in the game as well, with you being able to craft many different potions of different effects out of many different ingrediants.
And the world, i really enjoyed just exploring the massive world and slaughtering the all bandits and helpless animals i came across.

I reccomend Two Worlds but know that many people will not be able to get over its flaws.
If realty pump only had a little extra funding or more time or whatever, they could of made a truely epic game.

From the short while I have played this game I can tell you this. It is terrible! The dialog itself was enough to put me off for good.

One of the classics from our childhood. Put in context this game offered a lot of land to travel, side quests, freedom of movement and consequences for the deccisions you take. The main cons are the scarce explanations about how everything works and the DRM system, which was bad even for those years.

After this game they came great titles in the genere like Oblivion, Skyrim, The Witcher II, etc. So this one is nowadays suits best for nostalgic gamers and collectors.

Of course, if you get it at a reasonable price and you want to be patient and put some time into the game it's probably a title that will surprise you despite the first impression.

This game is fun!!..... with a few caveats.  You will go to great lengths to activate and play the game. You will overcome horrendous voice acting. You will tolerate this, that, and the other....Mayhap you will  find yourself engrossed, suddenly, in what is an incredibly fun RPG that has, in my opinion, nailed the levelling system. There are definite hurdles to overcome if you want to play this game. I would still, however, recommend this game to anyone who loves RPG's.

(Incredibly flawed but very entertaining RPG) 
Pro's
-Bad Voice Acting (very funny to listen to)
-Customization of items with gems
-Alchemy System
-Variety in weapons, spells, and monsters
-Nice loot system and Item stacking
Con's
-The game requires work to run (can crash, needs legacy drivers, ect)

-Easy to break the system and make a broken/godly character (using alchemy/gems)
Игра хорошая, но в наше время уже не для всех.

Back in 2006, [i]Elder Scrolls: Oblivion[/i] was the most popular open-world RPG, but a year later, [b]Two Worlds[/b] was released, and the RPG fans wonder how much batter it would be.

Well, 8 years have passed and Two Worlds remains forever in Oblivion’s shadow. Above all negative towers this [i]Reality Pump[/i] release, the story-line gets the worst part. Not-so-epic, and somehow basic, we take the role of a traveller searching for his sister who is mysteriously kidnaped. After being approached by a strange man who leads us to the main quest, we start our journey only to realise the side-quests are actually more interesting. Despise all the shortness, the main-quest encourages the player to explorer the kingdom, complete site-quests, gain reputation among the several available factions, choose a side among the war against the orcs, and discover new areas.
Much like Gothic series, this action RPG gives you the freedom to explore the world as you want, with an amazing combat system that puts you to the test by fighting bandits, goblins, wild animals, Cyclops, and many other creatures we are used to encounter in this genres. Getting yourself in the wrong side of the map might lead you to difficult enemies, but with great rewards worth the trouble.
Two Worlds offers a simple and interesting system where the player can create new items by cooking all sort of organic and magic objects. Mixing up till 5, the result may be different each time you tweak with the items, but you get to keep all the recipes for future use. New potions with a lot of different results are the most common, this will certainly make the game a lot easier, since harvesting items can be done pretty much everywhere. You can’t craft new weapons, but you can upgrade them, and that’s good enough. There’s plenty to choose from the vast variety of armour-sets, swords, staffs, and many more powerful objects to kill all those evil Golems!
The player also relies on magic, and for that the levelling up is great, choose among the 5 elements, and advance your combat skills and how well you manoeuvre your weapons.
Although the gameplay is flawless and the graphics try to keep with it, the major problem falls upon the text-dialogue. NPC are just repetitive, in both appearance and dialogues, and that’s really a shame, because some actually tell you interesting things about the world of Two Worlds. It’s a big map, but very repetitive, even with snow, desert and deep forests, the game lacks on dungeons with only a handful of them to complete and loot. Small huts and villages with hidden secrets might be your salvation after a long walk throughout the world. 

With great emphasis on side-quests, your journey won’t be a waste of time, and in time you may learn to enjoy it.
One of those games where you love it or hate it. Can’t go medium with this one, it’s made for RPG fans. Unless you are one, stay way.
Could be batter, but could be a lot worst considering all things! 6/10.

RPG старой школы..
Свободный мир, ты - сам по себе. Можно напасть на сильного врага и убить его, за счет уклонения от их медлительных атак. Конечно геймплей уже так не впечатляет как при старых временах, когда все еще играли в готику.. В целом есть своя изюминка, так же много кривнулек, по типу дурацкого управления лошадью, застревания на крутых склонах, застревания лошади (отчего приходиться оставлять ее и искать новую лошадь!) Хотя это можно назвать реализмом в какой-то мере)))
Лут рандомный, зависящий от уровня героя, враги кажется тоже. Поэтому всегда можно найти что-то редкое и ценное. Квесты разные, бывают интересные, бывают классически простетские (убей-получи, пойди-принеси).
В целом игра хорошая, музыка приятная, история мира интересная.
7/10
